Class GameController

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am33.controller.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
CallableOnGameController, Serializable, Remote
public class GameController extends UnicastRemoteObject implements CallableOnGameController

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController(String gameId, int maxPlayers, boolean isTestFlight, DNS dns) throws RemoteException
      Creates a new GameController instance.
      Parameters:
      gameId - The unique identifier for this game
      maxPlayers - Maximum number of players allowed in the game
      isTestFlight - Whether this is a test flight game mode
      dns - The DNS service for network communication
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If there is an error in remote communication

    • playerWantsToReserveFocusedComponent

      public void playerWantsToReserveFocusedComponent(String nickname)
      Handles a player's request to reserve a focused component during the game. The method verifies the game's current state and ensures the request is processed only if the game is in the appropriate state. If the game is not in the expected state, an error message is logged.
      Specified by:
      playerWantsToReserveFocusedComponent in interface CallableOnGameController
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player who wants to reserve the focused component

    • playerWantsToReleaseFocusedComponent

      public void playerWantsToReleaseFocusedComponent(String nickname)
      Handles the player's request to release the currently focused component on their shipboard. Ensures the action is performed only during the appropriate game state and updates the game model accordingly.
      Specified by:
      playerWantsToReleaseFocusedComponent in interface CallableOnGameController
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player requesting to release the focused component

    • playerEndsBuildShipBoardPhase

      public void playerEndsBuildShipBoardPhase(String nickname)
      Handles a player's request to end their ship board building phase. This method is called when a player has finished building their ship and wants to proceed. If all players have ended their building phase, the game state changes to CHECK_SHIPBOARD.
      Specified by:
      playerEndsBuildShipBoardPhase in interface CallableOnGameController
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player ending their building phase

    • playerPlacesPawn

      public void playerPlacesPawn(String nickname)
      Handles a player placing their pawn on the game board. When all players have placed their pawns, the game state changes to CHECK_SHIPBOARD.
      Specified by:
      playerPlacesPawn in interface CallableOnGameController
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player placing their pawn

    • handleClientChoice

      public void handleClientChoice(String nickname, PlayerChoicesDataStructure choice) throws IOException
      Handles a client's choice during gameplay. Processes the player's choice through the current adventure card.
      Specified by:
      handleClientChoice in interface CallableOnGameController
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player making the choice
      choice - The data structure containing the player's choices

      playerWantsToVisitLocation in interface CallableOnGameController
      Parameters:

    • playerWantsToRestartHourglass

      public void playerWantsToRestartHourglass(String nickname) throws RemoteException
      Handles a player's request to restart the hourglass timer. This can only be done during the BUILD_SHIPBOARD phase.
      Specified by:
      playerWantsToRestartHourglass in interface CallableOnGameController
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player requesting the restart
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If there is an error in remote communication

    • notifyHourglassEnded

      public void notifyHourglassEnded(String nickname)
      Notifies the game that the hourglass timer has ended for a player.

      Only allowed during the BUILD_SHIPBOARD phase. If the call occurs in a different phase, the method logs an error and returns without taking action.

      Specified by:
      notifyHourglassEnded in interface CallableOnGameController
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player whose timer ended

    • playerWantsToRemoveComponent

      public void playerWantsToRemoveComponent(String nickname, Coordinates coordinates)
      Handles a player's request to remove a component from their ship.

      This method:

      • Validates that the current game state allows removal.
      • Recalculates ship parts after removal and stores them for later player choice.
      • Updates the ship board by ejecting aliens and identifying disconnected parts.
      • Sends the updated ship board view to all clients, indicating whether it's valid or not.
      • Checks and triggers a phase transition if the board is valid and connected.
      Specified by:
      playerWantsToRemoveComponent in interface CallableOnGameController
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player requesting removal
      coordinates - The coordinates of the component to remove

    • playerChoseShipPart

      public void playerChoseShipPart(String nickname, Set<Coordinates> chosenShipPart) throws RemoteException
      Handles the player's decision to keep a specific ship part after a component removal caused disconnection.

      This method removes all other disconnected parts from the player's ship, leaving only the chosen one. It then notifies all clients with the updated ship status, indicating whether it is valid or not. Finally, it clears temporary ship parts and checks whether the phase should advance.

      Specified by:
      playerChoseShipPart in interface CallableOnGameController
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player making the selection
      chosenShipPart - The coordinates of the ship part the player chooses to keep
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If a remote communication error occurs

    • playerWantsToFocusReservedComponent

      public void playerWantsToFocusReservedComponent(String nickname, int choice)
      Handles a player's request to focus on a previously reserved component. Only available during the BUILD_SHIPBOARD phase.
      Specified by:
      playerWantsToFocusReservedComponent in interface CallableOnGameController
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player focusing the component
      choice - The index of the reserved component to focus

    • requestPrefabShips

      public void requestPrefabShips(String nickname) throws RemoteException

      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player requesting prefab ships
      Throws:

    • startCheckShipBoardAfterAttack

      public void startCheckShipBoardAfterAttack(String nickname)
      Initiates the ship board check after an attack event. Used in MeteoriteStorm, Pirates, and WarField events.
      Specified by:
      startCheckShipBoardAfterAttack in interface CallableOnGameController
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player whose ship is being checked

    • requestSelectPrefabShip

      public void requestSelectPrefabShip(String nickname, String prefabShipId) throws RemoteException
      Handles a player's request to select and apply a prefabricated ship design. Validates the selection and applies it to the player's ship board.
      Specified by:
      requestSelectPrefabShip in interface CallableOnGameController
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player selecting the prefab ship
      prefabShipId - The identifier of the chosen prefab ship
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If there is an error in remote communication

    • playerWantsToLand

      public void playerWantsToLand(String nickname)
      Handles a player's request to land their ship. This action is only available during certain game states. If all players have landed, the game transitions to END_GAME state.
      Specified by:
      playerWantsToLand in interface CallableOnGameController
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player requesting to land

    • debugSkipToLastCard

      public void debugSkipToLastCard() throws RemoteException
      Debug method to skip to the last card in the deck. Only works in certain game states and when the game has started.
      Specified by:
      debugSkipToLastCard in interface CallableOnGameController
      Throws:
      RemoteException - If there is an error in remote communication
